intro: Carphalea pervilleana, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branched. Carphalea pervilleana is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
